maml:description.maml:para: Starts an editor for the selected files in the fuzzy finder.

Allows the user to pick multiple files from fzf that will be launched in the editor defined in the environment variable EDITOR. Under Windows, Visual Studio Code is launched if EDITOR is not defined. If not running under Windows, vim is launched. If Invoke-FuzzyEdit is executed in the Visual Studio Code integrated terminal, the --reuse-window option is used which should cause the file to open in the currently active Visual Studio Code window.
Path to directory to start fzf in. If not passed defaults to current directory.
Path to directory to start fzf in. If not passed defaults to current directory.
This cmdlet does not accept any input.
This cmdlet does not generate any output.
Starts fzf with input from the files saved in fasd (non-Windows) or fasdr (Windows) and sets the current location.
Allows the user to select a file from fasd's database and set the current location.
This cmdlet does not accept any input.
This cmdlet does not generate any output.

maml:alert.maml:para: This function will be created if fasdr (https://github.com/kelleyma49/fasdr)can be found by PowerShell.

maml:description.maml:para: Starts fzf with input from output of the `git status` function.
Allows the user to select files listed from the output of the `git status` function executed in the current directory.
These keyboard shortcuts are supported:
- <kbd>CTRL+A</kbd> selects all items
- <kbd>CTRL+D</kbd> deselects all items
- <kbd>CTRL+T</kbd> toggles the selection state of all items
This cmdlet does not accept any input.
This cmdlet does not generate any output.
Rerun a previous command from history based on the user's selection in fzf.
Executes a command selected by the user in fzf.
This cmdlet does not accept any input.
This cmdlet does not generate any output.
Runs `Stop-Process` on processes selected by the user in fzf.
Runs Stop-Process on all processes selected by the the user in fzf.
This cmdlet does not accept any input.
This cmdlet does not generate any output.
Starts fzf on Scoop applications list.
Allows the user to select (multiple) applications from locally stored Scoop buckets and runs `subcommand` on them. Default value of `subcommand` is `install`.
The Scoop command that will be run on the selected applications.
A set of flags that will be additionally passed to the Scoop subcommand.
The Scoop command that will be run on the selected applications.
A set of flags that will be additionally passed to the Scoop subcommand.
This cmdlet does not accept any input.
This cmdlet does not generate any output.

maml:alert.maml:para: This function will be effective if Scoop (https://scoop.sh)can be found in PATH.

maml:description.maml:para: Sets the current location from the user's selection in fzf.
Set the current location of a subdirectory based on the user's selection in fzf.
The path to a directory that contains the subdirectories that the user will choose from.
The path to a directory that contains the subdirectories that the user will choose from.
This cmdlet does not accept any input.
This cmdlet does not generate any output.

command:example.maml:title: Set-Location to a subdirectory located in the Windows directory

maml:description.maml:para: Starts fzf with input from the history saved by ZLocation and sets the current location.
Allows the user to select a file from ZLocation's history database and set the current location.
This cmdlet does not accept any input.
This cmdlet does not generate any output.

maml:alert.maml:para: This function will be created if ZLocation (https://github.com/vors/ZLocation)can be found by PowerShell.

maml:description.maml:para: Starts the fuzzy file finder based on input from the pipeline.
The Add-Frecent function adds a path to the Fasdr database for the passed in provider.
Field delimiter regex (default: AWK-style)
Comma-separated list of sort criteria to apply when the scores are tied [length|begin|end|index] (default: length)
Filter mode. Do not start interactive finder.
The input to display in the interactive finder
Input prompt (default: '> ')
String to print as header
The first N lines of the input are treated as header
History file
Maximum number of history entries (default: 1000)
Command to preview highlighted line ({})
Preview window layout (default: right:50%) [up|down|left|right][:SIZE[%]][:hidden]
Start the finder with the given query
Case-insensitive match (default: smart-case match)
Case-sensitive match
Enable cyclic scroll
Exit immediately when there's no match
Extended-search mode (enabled by default; +x or --no-extended to disable)
Enable Exact-match
Display finder info inline with the query
Enable multi-select with tab/shift-tab
Disable horizontal scroll
Disable mouse
Do not sort the result
Reverse orientation
Reverse the order of the input
Automatically select the only match
Case-insensitive match (default: smart-case match)
Case-sensitive match
Enable cyclic scroll
Field delimiter regex (default: AWK-style)
Exit immediately when there's no match
Extended-search mode (enabled by default; +x or --no-extended to disable)
Enable Exact-match
Filter mode. Do not start interactive finder.
String to print as header
The first N lines of the input are treated as header
History file
Maximum number of history entries (default: 1000)
Display finder info inline with the query
The input to display in the interactive finder
Enable multi-select with tab/shift-tab
Disable horizontal scroll
Disable mouse
Do not sort the result
Command to preview highlighted line ({})
Preview window layout (default: right:50%) [up|down|left|right][:SIZE[%]][:hidden]
Input prompt (default: '> ')
Start the finder with the given query
Reverse orientation
Reverse the order of the input
Automatically select the only match
Comma-separated list of sort criteria to apply when the scores are tied [length|begin|end|index] (default: length)
Objects to display in the interactive finder
Objects selected by the user

dev:remarks.maml:para: Sets the current location based on the user selection in fzf.

maml:description.maml:para: Uses fzf as an interactive Ripgrep launcher
Uses Ripgrep and Fzf to interactively search files.
Initial string to start ripgrep query
Returns result instead of launching editor
Initial string to start ripgrep query
Returns result instead of launching editor
This cmdlet does not accept any input.
This cmdlet does not generate any output.

maml:alert.maml:para: This function is adapted from Fzf's advanced document (https://github.com/junegunn/fzf/blob/master/ADVANCED.md#switching-between-ripgrep-mode-and-fzf-mode). This function requires the installation of ripgrep (https://github.com/BurntSushi/ripgrep) and [bat](https://github.com/sharkdp/bat).

command:example.maml:title: -------- Launch Invoke-PsFzfRipgrep with search string --------
command:example.dev:code: Invoke-PsFzfRipgrep -SearchString 'Key' # Starts search with initial ripgrep query of the string 'Key'

maml:description.maml:para: Sets the current location based on the Everything database.
Allows the user to select a directory from the Everything database and sets the current location.
The path to a directory that contains the subdirectories that the user will choose from.
The path to a directory that contains the subdirectories that the user will choose from.
This cmdlet does not accept any input.
This cmdlet does not generate any output.

maml:alert.maml:para: This function will be created if PSEverything (https://github.com/powercode/PSEverything)can be found by PowerShell.

command:example.maml:title: - Launch Set-LocationFuzzyEverything specifying a path filter -

maml:description.maml:para: Sets the available PSFzf options.
Allows the user to set various PSFzf options, such as PSReadline chords and tab expansion.
PSReadline keyboard chord shortcut to trigger file and directory selection
PSReadline keyboard chord shortcut to trigger history selection
Enables key bindings for git commands.
Enables tab expansion support
Enables the `fe` aliases for the `Invoke-FuzzyEdit` function
Enables the `ff` aliases for the `Invoke-FuzzyFasd` function
Enables the `fh` aliases for the `Invoke-FuzzyHistory` function
Enables the `fkill` aliases for the `Invoke-FuzzyKillProcess` function
Enables the `fd` aliases for the `Invoke-FuzzySetLocation` function
Enables the `cde` aliases for the `Set-LocationFuzzyEverything` function
Enables the `fs` aliases for the `Invoke-FuzzyScoop` function
Enables the `fz` aliases for the `Invoke-FuzzySetZLocation` function
Enables the `fgs` aliases for the `Invoke-FuzzyGitStatus` function
uses the `fd` command instead of the OS specific file and directory commands
Specifies a user supplied command that will be used in the command that is bound to the Alt-C command
# example command - use $Location with a different command:
$commandOverride = [ScriptBlock]{ param($Location) Write-Host $Location }
# pass your override to PSFzf:
Set-PsFzfOption -AltCCommand $commandOverride
PSReadline keyboard chord shortcut to trigger file and directory selection
PSReadline keyboard chord shortcut to trigger history selection
Enables key bindings for git commands.
Enables tab expansion support
Enables the `fe` aliases for the `Invoke-FuzzyEdit` function
Enables the `ff` aliases for the `Invoke-FuzzyFasd` function
Enables the `fh` aliases for the `Invoke-FuzzyHistory` function
Enables the `fkill` aliases for the `Invoke-FuzzyKillProcess` function
Enables the `fd` aliases for the `Invoke-FuzzySetLocation` function
Enables the `cde` aliases for the `Set-LocationFuzzyEverything` function
Enables the `fs` aliases for the `Invoke-FuzzyScoop` function
Enables the `fz` aliases for the `Invoke-FuzzySetZLocation` function
Enables the `fgs` aliases for the `Invoke-FuzzyGitStatus` function
uses the `fd` command instead of the OS specific file and directory commands
Specifies a user supplied command that will be used in the command that is bound to the Alt-C command
# example command - use $Location with a different command:
$commandOverride = [ScriptBlock]{ param($Location) Write-Host $Location }
# pass your override to PSFzf:
Set-PsFzfOption -AltCCommand $commandOverride
This cmdlet does not generate any output.
